tweets.text:
We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

Monday 7th Dec - 6pm onwards
Pollution: Just because we can‚Äôt see it, it doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs not there! - public lecture with Prof Claire Gwinnett, @EleanorGraceSU and me !

Sign up on the link
https://t.co/RHTPxrfOle https://t.co/LajcAca8lZ

ICYMI: Guest Blog: How Nature Dies by Alistair Gammell https://t.co/TwtWsfjEUO

@EnvAgency @DefraGovUK https://t.co/PxSTpaMLQx

Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX

...It took 2 years 9 months to get a defective inlet drain that had tree root ingress and a hole replaced.

All the time the system was being flushed through with excess subsoil water, further deteriorating the discharge site üôÑ

What exactly did the @EnvAgency do?
@JamesBevanEA

https://t.co/a3eSamAaWX

"What are my responsibilities as a homeowner?

As a homeowner you are responsible for repairing your misconnections and preventing pollution"

It took 7 months to get rainwater downpipes removed and 14 months to get a French drain removed from this system

Another miserable river scrape down over c. 40 m of bank leading to mass non-natural soil erosion & habitat loss on the Great Ouse. Don't expect this to be good for spawning barbel @EnvAgency https://t.co/5RIOzVVXcc

Sharks are more vulnerable than they seem ü¶à

Demand for shark parts has decimated shark populations.

We're looking at what can be done to further protect these precious creatures.

Have your say: https://t.co/maU4Jf3u7q 

#BetterLivesForAnimals #SharkFinning https://t.co/rwkVJz1egv

The flood warnings are no longer in place however we still have several flood alerts in force ‚ö†Ô∏è 

Remember just an egg cup of water is enough to ruin your engine.

Don‚Äôt drive through flood water‚ö†Ô∏è 

#Flood #Safety https://t.co/gsB4iKsx2d https://t.co/MV8aBYJ6jI

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@supercell_1996 @jcreedy @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency The Lugg USED to flood here.
Ho9w do you know they finished the job?

@RobGMacfarlane @stevethomas100 @EnvAgency Wrong! A farmer cleared out a stretch of river removing some logs that was blocking the river, to prevent flooding because environmental agencies were doing nothing, the banks will be back to normal within 12 months

@harrietalvis @EnvAgency Harriet, great to see you haven‚Äôt  given up supporting the Environment , these decisions on small areas affect the wider areas and I know you will get those in power to understand
